de.psi.efload.packerapi
Interface IncrementalPacker

public interface IncrementalPacker

Defines the interface of a packing algorithm that constructs a sequence of loading plans by adding loading and unloading events incrementally. The contract between the packer and its caller includes the following clauses:

  • The packer is responsible for the spatial arrangement of packages in a container.
  • The packer is called during construction of a loading schedule which consists of a sequence of loading plans.
  • The packer itself is stateless, i.e. there is no intrinsic connection between successive calls to load and unload.
  • The packer guarantees that unloading a previously loaded tour transport is always possible.
  • The caller uses the same instance of TourTransport for corresponding calls to load and unload.
  • The packer may throw a RuntimeException if it detects a violation of this contract.
  • The packer does not change the received loading plan but creates a new one for each call.

Author:
kschroeder

Method Summary
 LoadingResult load(PackageSet packageSet, ContainerType[] containerTypes, LoadingPlan loadingPlan)
          Tries to add a package set to the specified loading plan.
 LoadingPlan unload(PackageSet packageSet, ContainerType[] containerTypes, LoadingPlan loadingPlan)
          Unloads a package set from the specified container.
 

Method Detail

load

LoadingResult load(PackageSet packageSet,
                   ContainerType[] containerTypes,
                   LoadingPlan loadingPlan)
Tries to add a package set to the specified loading plan.

Parameters:
packageSet - Defines the packages to be loaded into the container.
containerTypes - The types of the containers into which the packages are to be loaded. The index into this array is used to identify the container in the loading plan, see Package.getContainerIndex().
loadingPlan - The loading plan containing packages which are already contained in the container. This may be null for the first loading event of a tour.
Returns:
null on failure or the result containing the new loading plan on success.

unload

LoadingPlan unload(PackageSet packageSet,
                   ContainerType[] containerTypes,
                   LoadingPlan loadingPlan)
Unloads a package set from the specified container.

Precondition: The same set has been loaded before.

Parameters:
packageSet - Defines the packages to be unloaded from the container.
containerTypes - The types of the containers into which the packages are to be loaded. The index into this array is used to identify the container in the loading plan, see Package.getContainerIndex().
loadingPlan - The packages which are contained in the container.
Returns:
The new loading plan.
